description.narrative: Arms Trade Treaty (ATT) entered into force in December 2014. The Treaty underlines the need to prevent and eradicate the illicit trade in conventional arms and to prevent their diversion to the illicit market or for unauthorized end-users. A voluntary Tru st Fund (VTF) was established at the Second Conference of the State Parties in August 2016. It assists States requiring international assistance to implement the Treaty. The VTF will assist in strengthening of legislation regulation and capacity building o n arms export import and transit control in developing countries. It also tackles the illicit trade in arms. Finland contribute in 2017 EUR 300 000 to the VTF. Subject to parliamentary approval the contribution will be at the same level in 2018. The pri mary beneficiaries will be the governments that take part to capacity building activities. Strengthened security will on a long run benefit the whole population of the recipient country.
